content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `find`. It computes median over arbitrary array. Provide an example

```julia
function find(arr::AbstractArray)
    n = length(arr)
    sorted = sort(arr, alg=Quicksort)
    medians = []

    if iseven(n)
        push!(medians, mean(sorted[div(n, 2):end]))
        push!(medians, mean(sorted[1:div(n, 2)]))
    else
        push!(medians, sorted[div(n, 2)+1])
    end

    return medians[1]
end

# Example
julia> find([1,2,3,4,5,6])
5.5

julia> find([1,2,3,4])
3.0

julia> find([1,2])
1.5
```
This function `find` computes the median of an arbitrary array by first sorting the array using quicksort algorithm and then returning the middle value(s) according to the length of the array. It supports arrays of any type.
